Product description

Colour:Black Texture

Multipurpose Laptop Suited for Varied Use

Engineered to suit all types of usage, the Lenovo Ideapad 80UD00RYIH is the perfect laptop for home or office use. Use it as a multimedia device for your entertainment needs or to process important office documents with equal ease. With the ability to load any compatible operating system of your choice, this laptop can be used for tasks such as software programming, internet browsing, watching movies and more. The 15.6-inch bright screen has great viewing angles and accurate colour reproduction, making this laptop a pleasure to use.

Powerful Hardware with Long Battery Life

With a sixth generation Intel Core i3 processor under the hood and 4GB of DDR4 RAM, the Lenovo Ideapad 80UD00RYIH is well suited to handle intensive tasks and heavy multitasking without breaking a sweat. The integrated graphics helps you ease through surfing, multimedia and light gaming tasks. Store your media, data and software applications on the large 1TB hard drive without worrying about low storage issues.

Highly Portable with Multiple Connectivity Features

Backed by a 4-hour battery life and weighing at only 2.2 kgs, the Lenovo Ideapad 80UD00RYIH is an ideal laptop for carrying around and working on the go. Its compact and fully featured is ergonomically designed to give you a highly efficient typing experience. Featuring 802.11 b/g/n Wi-Fi and Bluetooth 4.0, experience instant connectivity to the internet or other devices with this laptop.

From the manufacturer



Intel 6th Generation Core i3 Processor

A perfect balance of value and performance, Intel 6th Gen Core i3 Processor are designed with mobility in mind. Their efficient use of power means you can go longer without recharging your battery.

Thin, Light and Portable

Never lug a heavy, clunky laptop around again. Weighing in at a mere 2.3 kg, the ideapad is perfect for an on-the go lifestyle.

Stay Connected

With 802.11 b/g/n wifi connectivity and bluetooth 4.0, you can connect to the internet most wherever you go.

Read more



Engineered for Value

Everything you need. Nothing you don’t. If you’re looking for an affordable laptop that doesn’t sacrifice on performance, the Lenovo ideapad is the notebook for you.

Compact Keyboard

The keyboard has a good amount of click to the keys. A column of keys dedicated to the home block (delete, home, end, page up, page down) is included.

Extra Peace of Mind

Leaving your laptop unattended in a busy café could be an expensive call. Fortunately, the ideapad 100 is compatible with Kensington MiniSaver cable locks. These sturdy cables let you secure your ideapad 100 to a heavy or immovable object. So you can visit friends at another table or order more coffee without worry.

4.0 out of 5 starsIS THIS THE BEST LAPTOP AROUND 23K? Read my review to find out // HONEST REVIEW
ByAbraham JOSEPHTOP 10 REVIEWERon 19 June 2017
Colour: Silver
Hey everyone! If you are looking for a laptop below 25k for daily usage then you are at the right place. Please consider reading my review before you look any further.Personally, I have used and reviewed many laptops in amazon ,So you can totally rely on my review. If you did checkout my amazon profile ,I have also reviewed many other laptops and also made my choice of best laptop in 35k range...You can checkout my review over here: www.amazon.in/review/R19BIA3G7WXDBZ

NOTE: The price keeps messing around. When I reviewed this laptop it was selling for 23k. Now after I reviewed it ,they Increased it to 26k.

Recently, one of my friend asked me to suggest him a laptop within 20-25k range.He wanted a laptop which offered decent performance, web browsing ,microsoft office etc. So, I went online and searched for the perfect option.I did a lot of research and analysed all choices before making my final decision and that would be this very own Lenovo Ideapad 110.

But I gotta admit that this ain't a perfect laptop because there are things you have to sacrifice because of its cheap price tag.

●●SPECIFICATION●●
►2GHz Intel Core I3-6006U 6th Gen processor
►Intel HD 520 Graphics (No inbuilt memory)
►4GB DDR3 RAM (expandable)
►1TB 5400rpm Hard Disk
►15.6-inch screen,1366 x 768 pixels resolution
►3 Cells Battery
►DOS operating system
►2.3 kg weight

NOTE: I am posting this review on 19-06-2017 and my opinions are based on today's laptop market trend.So if you are reading this after 1 year ,then definitely not the best review to rely on.

●[DESIGN] -The build corresponds to the price level. The gaps are mostly even and rough edges are not palpable.Considering the price tag ,you can't really expect high quality chassis. The entire body is made of polycarbonate plastic which is a lil fingerprint magnet.The lid feels pretty nice, smooth and “grippy” so it’s easy to carry it around. With a slightly different finish, the interior of the Ideapad 110 resembles faux leather to touch but it’s easy to see that it’s plastic. The wrist rest area is solid and rigid. The same goes for the trackpad area, which uses two stiff mouse buttons instead of a whole touchpad plate and I strongly prefer this design on a low-end machine for sure. Usually, the entry-level notebooks have flimsy touchpad design so the one on the Ideapad 110 will suit most users pretty well.

●[DISPLAY] -The Ideapad 110 uses a budget 15-inch WXGA TN panel with 1366 x 768 HD resolution ,which is widely used in most of the budget devices.In real life you may not find much difference until you compare it with some beastly displays like the Retina ones. Though it is good for watching or streaming HD videos, surfing the Web, working on document and all.its clear and crisp enough for the price.

●[KB] -A Backlit keyboard is usually not equipped in budget laptops,same goes with this one.The keyboard is decent for the price range.The short key travel is understandable but the feedback when pressing the keys should have been a little bit better.Anyway ,most people may not notice it unless they compare it with high end devices.

●[SPEAKERS] - The speakers are in the front ,above the KB section. Well ,as usual it isn't quite loud.However, for daily use or moderately loud music, it's going to be just fine.I didn’t notice any major distortions at low, mid and high frequencies but as I said ,the maximum volume isn’t high enough.Anyway, You can always buy a bluetooth speaker for better and louder audio.

●[GAMING -] It comes with HD 520 GPU which don't have Integrated memory ,it rather utilizes the RAM memory. It is still capable of running games like FIFA 15, DOTA 2 ,CS GO, CALL OF DUTY MODERN WARFARE and many more if you reduce the graphics settings.

●[PERFORMANCE] -Although this is a budget laptop, it does not stick out in performance .I mean ,For normal day to day tasks such as web surfing, video playback, on demand videos, and word processing this is quite enough for many.It has the latest i3 processor (6006u and not 6100(better))which can guarantee better performance than most in this price bracket.Its surely capable of handling day to day tasks with ease.Also some occasional gaming.If you are a pro with video editing and stuff then I would recommend getting something with i5 or i7.

● [OS] -This laptop doesn't come with an OS installed, anyway you can download and install the latest version of Windows 10. It runs the latest windows 10 creators update perfectly without any lag or so. There is an inbuilt gaming mode in windows 10 which surely helps boost its gaming performance at least to some extent .

●[RAM ] It comes with the old school DDR3 RAM which in my opinion is quite slow when compared with the DDR4 RAMS installed in laptops above 25k and so.Anyway you need not worry about it.

●[BATTERY ] - battery life here is lil below average because its just 3 cell .So I got battery life around 3hrs on normal usage. If you are gaming them expect something less than an hour.I found that the HP one offers slightly better battery life. I Also own another laptop ,the dell 3558 which offered around 6+ hrs of battery life but that one comes with 5th gen i3 and ddr3 memory.

FINAL VERDICT
-----------------------
Well ,there are few other choices like Dell Vostro 3468 ,which is currently the "Amazon's choice laptop" because it comes with the latest 7th gen i3 processor and a far better battery life.But as of now Dell Vostro 3468 is selling for 34k. Anyway ,the difference between the 2 generations will be small at best(5% to 10% difference). Its an i3 so its to be expected. The only reason to wait for the new chips to be released would be to see "if" Intel will lower the prices on the 6th gen chips and that's what have happened here ,in the case of Lenovo IdeaPad 110.

Finally, I didn't find any laptop in this range (20-23k)which can compete with this laptop.But it is to be noted that the battery life is not as good as claimed by amazon or lenovo.

Thanks for reading my review. I hope that my review proved helpful for all users ,who are searching for a laptop in this price range.For any further info ,feel free to contact me directly or comment down below.

[...]. Have a nice day :)

Peace☮
-Abraham
